intro: Isopyrum uniflorum, commonly known as the single-flower grass, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the northern regions of North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly referred to as the sedge family. The plant typically features slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in spikelets. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along the edges of ponds. Its botanical characteristics make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
